Golden Gate Park:Bound by the Richmond and Sunset Districts, Haight-Ashbury and Ocean Beach

Grandview Park:Located south of Golden Gate Park in San Francisco’s Sunset District
Buena Vista Park:Located where the famed Haight-Ashbury neighborhood meets Buena Vista Heights
Golden Gate Bridge:The City’s most iconic structure has stood proudly over the San Francisco Bay since 1937
Alcatraz Island:Probably the most famous prison in the world, the island fortress of Alcatraz once held some of America’s most dangerous and notorious prisoners
Ferry Building Marketplace:A food mecca that rivals Seattle’s Pike’s Place Market
Alamo Square:San Francisco boasts hundreds of “Painted Ladies,” colorful Victorian and Edwardian domiciles featuring three
Cable Cars:In a city of hills, cable cars were once one of the most efficient ways to get around town
